text: Recent studies have demonstrated an important role for BMP superfamily members in hematopoietic stem cells , early thymocytes [ 6 , 7 ] and B-cell malignancies [ 8 , 11 , 12 ] , but a role for BMPs in normal human B cells has previously not been reported .

The present study demonstrated a significant antiproliferative effect of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in peripheral blood <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + B cells .

Additionally , <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced cell death in <extra_id_0> CD27 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + memory B cells as well as in a Burkitt lymphoma cell line ( Ramos ) .

Importantly , <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced a rapid and marked increase in <extra_id_0> Smad-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation .

text: In the present study , the demonstrated antiproliferative effect of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in anti-IgM treated B cells was significant and dose - dependent .

Importantly , the anti-proliferative effect of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could be completely neutralized by the use of a natural inhibitor , <extra_id_0> Noggin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
This is in line with others , showing that <extra_id_0> Noggin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can function as a <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antagonist [ 21 , 22 ] .

text: In addition , the combination of soluble <extra_id_0> BMP-RIB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Fc and <extra_id_0> BMP-RII <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Fc fusion proteins also neutralized the anti-proliferative effect of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human B cells .
Interestingly , as for other TGF family members , bifunctional effects have also been demonstrated for BMPs .

Whereas several of the BMPs have been shown to promote proliferation in various cell types including condrocytes [ 23 ] , liver [ 24 ] and granulosa cells [ 25 ] , antiproliferative effects and induction of apoptosis has been reported for B and T lineage cells .

Similar effects as demonstrated for <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on human B cells in the present study , were demonstrated for <extra_id_0> BMP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> 4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> 6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> -7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human myeloma cells [ 9-11 ] .
Other members of the BMP-family have also been reported to induce apoptosis , including in mouse B lineage cells [ 26 ] .
Additionally , <extra_id_0> BMP-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits thymocyte proliferation [ 6 ] .
Taken together , these data suggest that the role of BMPs in the regulation of proliferation and apoptosis is highly cell type dependent .

text: Furthermore , Id proteins are known as important parts of signalling pathways involved in development , cell cycle and tumorigenesis [ 32 ] .

It is well established that various members of the Id family are overexpressed in a range of human tumours and generally , <extra_id_0> Id1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> appears to be the family member most widely overexpressed in a variety of human malignancies [ 41 ] , including multiple myeloma [ 42 , 32 ] .

Additionally , our findings that <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activates intracellular signalling pathways in human B cells might be of potential pathophysiological significance in lymphoma and inflammation .
High <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression in DLBCL has been shown to correlate to unfavourable outcome [ 12 ] .

text: However , our attempts to study <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein levels were unsuccessful due to problems with unspecific binding of the anti-BMP-6 antibodies tested , and lack of specific staining in control cells known to express <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA .
In contrast , the recombinant protein was readily detected .
In that respect , few investigators have detected <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein in humans , especially in non-pathogenic tissue .

text: In this study , a role for BMPs in the inflammatoric process of arthritis was suggested .
The upregulation of the <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - transcripts after IgM-crosslinking is of pathophysiologic interest [ 12 ] .

A loss of <extra_id_0> TGF-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - responsiveness has been suggested to be a critical contribution to malignant transformation [ 47 , 48 ] and similar oncogenic mechanisms have been postulated for BMPs .

Lines of evidence suggest [ 49 ] that at early stages of carcinogenesis , <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is not a tumour promoter , but suppresses benign and malignant tumour outgrowth .

These findings are in good agreement with previous findings for other <extra_id_0> TGF-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> family members , including <extra_id_0> TGF-beta1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> BMP-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 50 ] , indicating that cellular context of the BMP target cell might define the various observed effects .

In contrast to the upregulation of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcript in B cells , we were not able to detect <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcripts in human peripheral blood <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + or <extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells ( resting or stimulated with anti - <extra_id_0> CD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ; data not shown ) , consistent with the findings in T cell lines [ 20 ] and T cells in mice [ 43 ] .

text: Other potential <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> sources for mature B cells in vivo might be other cells of the immune system or tissue with contact to the hematopoietic system .
One well recognized source for <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production is the human bone and bone marrow stroma [ 51 , 8 ] .

Furthermore , it is noteworthy that human umbilical vein endothelial cells ( HUVEC ) highly express <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA [ 52 ] , and vascular endothelium has been reported to produce <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 53 ] .

text: These studies might imply a role for <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in transendothelial migration of B cells .
<extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA has been demonstrated in murine macrophage cell lines , but not in humans [ 54 ] .

In accordance with these findings , other human cell lines of neutrophil and monocytic origin have been described to be negative for the <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcript [ 20 ] .
To our knowledge , there is currently no report about <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production of human dendritic cells .
